Obs: In South America cultivated for the cinnamon-like flavour of the leaves and bark.  In Brazil the bark and seeds are used medicinally.
The fruits are sweet, the timber is used for construction and charcoal.
Apareceu na base de dados, mas sem registro de uso
flavouring for tobacco, liqueurs and other foodstuffs.
In tropical America cultivated for ist edible seeds. From the seeds an oil is extracted for soap and as lubricant.
bàri djwa (Kayapó Indians) + me krê ka kô (Kayapó Indians) + game attractant
pi tai te (Kayapó Indians, Brazil) - planted by the Kayapó tribe as game attractant
edible fruits which are also used for the preparation of marmalade
cultivated as a fruit tree in the native area, fruits with agreeable flavour. Formerly the latex of the trunk has been tapped. The wood provides an useful timber
cutitiribá grande. Cultivated in the Amazonas area of BRAZIL as a fruit tree. The timber is used locally.
Cultivated by the Kayapó Indians in NE Brazil as medicinal plant
